title: This Decorating Technique Separates the Pros from the Amateurs
text:
AMATEUR DECORATORS LIKE you and me struggle with the same array of variables that interior designers do: furniture, lighting, paint, artwork, rugs, window treatments, cats determined to destroy those window treatments. But pros take into account an overarching factor that eludes untrained eyes: a room’s visual connection to the adjacent space.

“It’s all about the procession,” said Andrew Franz, an architect and interior designer in New York. As soon as you enter a home, he believes, your eye should be led to another visual...
description: Decorate any space like a design-school graduate by factoring in the aesthetic visible in the room next door.
